speaker: Cellar
lines: Barrels dream of rivers; bottles dream of becoming stories.
A chalk line marks where rats agreed not to cross and sometimes remember.
A trapdoor remembers being a door more than a trap.
Footprints in flour loop once around a crate and become confused.
A small door in the stone wall pretends it is not a door.
You hear a cough with no lungs behind it.
The air smells like spilled secrets and dill.
A ladder leads up to a bookcase and then also doesn't.

choices.text: Kick a crate and see who complains.
